annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 17-353 validated a previously made technical correction.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: Section 17 of D.C. Law 17-63 repealed this section as of the date when the District of Columbia Free Clinic Captive Insurance Company becomes operational.
Section 19(b) of D.C. Law 17-63 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2182(b) of Fiscal Year 2007 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2006 (D.C. Act 16-477, August 8, 2006, 53 DCR 7068).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2182(b) of Fiscal Year 2007 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2006 (D.C. Act 16-499, October 23, 2006, 53 DCR 8845).
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 2182(b) of Fiscal Year 2007 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2007 (D.C. Act 17-1, January 16, 2007, 54 DCR 1165).

annoGroup.heading: Expiration of Law
annoGroup.text: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 1-307.21.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Repeal of Part B: Section 16 of D.C. Law 17-196 provided: “The Free Clinic Assistance Program Act of 1986, effective September 23, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-155; D.C. Official Code § 1-307.21 et seq.), is repealed as of the date when the Agency becomes operational.”
